text: Hi.

Welcome to another episode
of 'This is Architecture'.

I'm Jhalak, 
and we have Shaun from Contact Suite today.
Hi Jhalak.
It's great to be here.
Thanks, Shaun.

Why don't we start 
with telling us about yourself and Contact Suite?
Yes.

Contact centers now
more than ever need to be agile,

flexible and scalable
without the compromise of quality or agility.
Now Contact Suite the product
which allows Contact Centers to scale.
It enhances the agent experience,

but allowing both Contact Centers
to both scale people
as well as systems.

Right, I would love to see
how you scale people.
Let's walk straight into the architecture.
Right, so we have our caller here.

Caller Carrie needs some help
from the Contact Center.

She will make a call,
which is delivered into Amazon Connect.
This will be chat or voice.
At the same time agent Andy,

who has only just started
with the Contact Center today
logs in to Contact Suite via his browser
using 2FA of course.
Call her Carrie.
Comes into Amazon Connect.
She might go into an IVR,

interact with the IVR
and then the call due to integration

between Connect
and Contact Suite directly.
The call will be presented directly to agent Andy

using the same browser
he's already logged into.
Right.

So I'd love to see
how you mention security here.

And how do you optimize time
for agent Andy?

Well, agent Andy
using some smart automation
and self-service.

On the IVR Carrie will input
either touch tone or voice commands.

Now with logic through that
and Connect contact flows
and the use of Lambda that will determine

whether the call needs
to be dealt with agent Andy,
if it's slightly more complex,

or it can go
through that self-service automated process.

We have some microservices
in the ECS platform,

which will connect 
out to some third party CRMs.

Although likes of Siebel 
or Salesforce or so on.

And then through,
if they do need to go through agent Andy

agent, Andy will receive
a screen pop from Contact Suite.

This is a customized form,
which will have information,
questions, or processes that Andy has to follow.
Alongside that we have our Sense IQ knowledge base.

Now Sense IQ can be embedded
within that same contact suite screen pop,

or agent Andy can have it
on a separate browser instance.
All these tools together really help agent Andy
deal with Carrie's call on that first call.

Right, it is cool to see how agent Andy
is now enabled

on his first day with knowledge base,
and self-services.

You mentioned you have chat and voice,
do you get emails as well?
Yes we do.
We certainly do.

Email is a big part
of Contact Centers these days.
We currently use SES with Amazon.

Now emails are handled in Contact Suite
exactly the same as a chat or a voice.

We can use the same automation
using ECS microservices,
if they need to go to CRMs.
And they're presented through to agent Andy
exactly the same with a screen pop.
Cool.
So chat, voice, emails, all covered.

Do you have to measure statistics
or KPIs for Contact Center?
Yes.

So KPIs and reporting
are really crucial for Contact Centers.
So we retain data,
and we get the data directly from Connect

from Contact Suite itself,
and even Sense IQ.

Now these reports,
these can be served directly into Contact Suite.

They can be individual reports
that get sent out to customers

or data can be put into tools
using QuickSight or the likes of Power BI.

Wow, it is great to see how
Contact Center is able to scale

and provide better customer experience

Thank you, and we are really excited to see

Thanks, Shaun, for sharing this architecture.
And thanks for watching 'This is My Architecture'.
